extendedIngredients.name: chicken thighs
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 Chicken Thighs (You can also use chicken breasts and legs)
metaInformation: (You can also use chicken breasts and legs)

extendedIngredients.name: extra virgin olive oil
extendedIngredients.originalString: Extra Virgin Olive Oil, for frying

extendedIngredients.name: juice of lemon
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 c. Buttermilk (I used 2c. 2% milk + fresh juice of 2 lemons)

recipes.title: Buttermilk Fried Chicken | Carrie's Experimental Kitchen

winePairing.pairingText: Chicken can be paired with Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. You could try Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 27 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Ghost Pines Sonoma County Napa County Monterey County Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Selected from three of California's most recognized Chardonnay appellations, Sonoma, Monterey and Napa, our Ghost Pines Chardonnay offers expressive, fruit-forward characteristics. The artful combination of these three regions delivers baked apple, pear and lemon cream flavors, accented by an elegant finish of sweet vanilla.

recipes.instructions: Rinse the chicken under cold water and pat dry with paper towels.Add the chicken to a resealable plastic bag along with the buttermilk and refrigerate for at least 2 hours (you can leave them there all day if you'd like). Remove the chicken from the refrigerator 10 minutes before you're ready to fry. Prepare the coating mixture by mixing together the flour, salt, pepper, onion powder, garlic powder, dry mustard and thyme.Pour the oil into a large pot, Dutch oven or deep fryer and allow to heat over medium-high heat.Coat the chicken one piece at a time by dredging it into the flour mixture; then add the chicken to the oil. (You may have to work in two batches to avoid overcrowding).Fry the chicken 7-8 minutes per side; allowing them to turn golden brown.Drain the chicken on paper towels; then place on a baking sheet lined with a rack or foil.Bake the chicken at 350 degrees for 10-15 minutes or until the chicken has reached proper internal temperature.

steps.step: Rinse the chicken under cold water and pat dry with paper towels.
Add the chicken to a resealable plastic bag along with the buttermilk and refrigerate for at least 2 hours (you can leave them there all day if you'd like).

Remove the chicken from the refrigerator 10 minutes before you're ready to fry. Prepare the coating mixture by mixing together the flour, salt, pepper, onion powder, garlic powder, dry mustard and thyme.

Pour the oil into a large pot, Dutch oven or deep fryer and allow to heat over medium-high heat.Coat the chicken one piece at a time by dredging it into the flour mixture; then add the chicken to the oil. (You may have to work in two batches to avoid overcrowding).Fry the chicken 7-8 minutes per side; allowing them to turn golden brown.
Drain the chicken on paper towels; then place on a baking sheet lined with a rack or foil.
Bake the chicken at 350 degrees for 10-15 minutes or until the chicken has reached proper internal temperature.
